info.game_comments:
2001 Back to School Week game 1.
Introduction of the "new" Clue Crew.

jeopardy_round: WHAT I DID ON SUMMER VACATION

(1, 1).clue: The Lord’s Prayer begins by addressing God who "art in" this place

(2, 1).clue: Punch a wick hole in the bottom of an empty milk carton, melt some wax & you're on your way to making this

(3, 1).clue: The Great Lake Aquarium featured fish that live in this kind of water, as opposed to saltwater

(4, 1).clue: If string licorice is 20 cents a foot, a yard costs this much

(5, 1).clue: Rode a mule from the south rim to the floor of this landmark to go whitewater rafting on the Colorado River

(6, 1).clue: It took 48 pigs (& an animatronic double) to play this '95 title ham role

(1, 2).clue: God told Abraham to sacrifice his son, then sent one of these messengers to say, "never mind"

(2, 2).clue: Go dotty & make a pair of these out of clay; the opposite sides should add up to 7

(3, 2).clue: It's fun to ride the riverboat from the Audubon Zoo to the Aquarium of the Americas in this Louisiana city

(4, 2).clue: If Fred can eat 5 figs in 5 minutes, he can eat this many in a half hour

(5, 2).clue: Learned to surf while staying on Waikiki on this Hawaiian island

(6, 2).clue: In a nod to the TV show of Tim Allen, voice of Buzz Lightyear, a "Binford Tools" toolbox appears in this '95 film

(1, 3).clue: From the Latin for "threefold", it's the understanding of God as including Father, Son, & Holy Spirit

(2, 3).clue: String together one of these Hawaiian necklaces using construction paper flowers, straws & yarn

(3, 3).clue: These "tuxedoed" birds are a highlight of the Splash Zone at the Monterey Bay Aquarium

(4, 3).clue: If 25% of the total U. S. Senate voted yea on a law, this many Senators voted nay

(5, 3).clue: Went to Yellowstone & saw this geyser erupt right on schedule, as its name promised

(6, 3).clue: The "First Movie" from this card game features an evil clone, Mewtwo, who wanted to rule the world

(1, 4).clue: In the Bible God often speaks through these people, like Isaiah & Jeremiah

(2, 4).clue: With a brown lunch bag, white yarn for the top stitching & a little imagination, you can make one of these; hike!

(3, 4).clue: Seen here, the beluga type of this mammal is one of the main attractions at Chicago's Shedd Aquarium

(4, 4).clue: Number of kids you need to form 16 3-legged race teams

(5, 4).clue: Stayed at the Ahwahnee Hotel in the valley of this national park; saw Glacier Point & Half Dome on a hike

(6, 4).clue: Alec Baldwin played Mr. Conductor on this title steam engine's "Magic Railroad"

(1, 5).clue: Psalm 50 declares that God is this, like those found on Earth in a courtroom

(2, 5).clue: You can shake things up after making this wintry item using a baby food jar, water, sparkles & tiny figures

(3, 5).clue: On April 13, 2001 a bottlenose one of these mammals was born at the National Aquarium in Baltimore

(4, 5).clue: As the school yearbook can fit 12 student photos on a page, it would need this many pages for 144 students

(5, 5).clue: Loved the Gown Gallery--an exhibit about the First Ladies--in this Smithsonian museum

(6, 5).clue: Dickie Jones voiced this Disney wooden puppet who dreamed of becoming a real boy

(1, 1).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew does his darndest to topple at an exhibit at the California Science Center.) On the high-wire bike, a weight lowers the rider's center of this, so it's almost impossible to fall! ...Whoa!

(2, 1).clue: The icon seen here is also the founder, spokesman & namesake of this fast-food chain

(4, 1).clue: Style of music that's the main subject of Word Up! Magazine

(5, 1).clue: "Rumple Who?" is an interactive musical based on this fairy tale

(6, 1).clue: He got more popular votes for president than George W. Bush in 2000 but lost the election

(1, 2).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew visits Tess, the 50-foot-tall woman at the California Science Center.) As Tess' heart pumps to supply extra oxygen, the lights represent this system that distributes blood

(2, 2).clue: Head chef since 1993, Andrew Selvaggio has served billions & billions for this restaurant

(4, 2).clue: Gimme a C.  Gimme an H.  Gimme a couple of Es--soon you'll have the mag for the "American" one of these

(5, 2).clue: When this animated film became a Broadway musical, Rafiki became a female character

(6, 2).clue: The first book of the Bible, or a Phil Collins rock band

(1, 3).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew picks up some chicks at the California Science Center.) Directional term for the short, fluffy feathers seen on this newly hatched chick

(2, 3).clue: The girl seen here is the logo of this burger chain

(4, 3).clue: These twins seen here launched their own magazine in 2001

(5, 3).clue: Based on Frances Hodgson Burnett's book, this musical is named for the "secret" place

(6, 3).clue: Last name of the brothers who first published their fairy tales in 1812

(1, 4).clue: (Sofia of the Clue Crew climbs the rock climbing wall at the California Science Center.) A climber who shouts "Give!" to his belayer is asking for more of this--give!

(2, 4).clue: The BK Broiler & Chicken Tenders are on the menu at this chain

(4, 4).clue: In the Girls' Life story "Can I Date My BFF's old BF?", BFF is best friend forever & BF is short for this

(5, 4).clue: In "Starmites 2001" Eleanor enters the world of this kind of "book" & becomes a "superhero girl"

(6, 4).clue: This "thirst quencher" comes in such flavors as Citrus Cooler, Tropical Burst & Cool Blue Raspberry

(1, 5).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew shakes things up at the California Science Center.) I'm learning how earthquakes happen, when these continental sections are pushed together or pulled apart

(2, 5).clue: The Big Montana is one of the signature roast beef sandwiches from this restaurant

(4, 5).clue: The supplement seen here came with a 2000 issue of this magazine

(5, 5).clue: Mrs. Potts & Lumiere both wear wigs made of yak hair in this popular musical

(6, 5).clue: In computers, it's a measure of storage capacity equal to 1 billion bytes

(0, 0).clue: It's the only U.S. state that touches 2 oceans
